questions.text: I enjoy spending time with someone who introduces me to new ideas or activities.
I prefer a volunteer who enjoys routines and keeps things predictable.
I prefer a volunteer who is more spontaneous than structured.
I prefer spending time with someone who is easygoing and flexible rather than structured.
I enjoy having conversations with someone who is lively and talkative.
I would feel most comfortable with a volunteer who is calm rather than energetic.
I like when a volunteer checks in on me regularly rather than waiting for me to reach out.
I feel comfortable with someone who lets me take the lead in conversations and activities rather than guiding me.
I would like a volunteer who can help me stay relaxed and positive in challenging moments.
I feel more connected to people who openly express their thoughts and emotions rather than keeping them private.
I enjoy discovering new hobbies or exploring unfamiliar activities.
I like hearing different perspectives and learning from people with unique experiences.
I prefer familiar routines over spontaneous changes.
I find creative expression—such as music, writing, or art—exciting and fulfilling.
I enjoy conversations that explore new ideas and ways of thinking.
I like to plan ahead and keep things organized.
When I start a task, I do my best to see it through to the end.
I sometimes find it easier to go with the flow than to stick to a schedule.
Being reliable and following through on commitments is important to me.
I feel most productive when I have a clear plan or routine to follow.
I enjoy spending time around people and engaging in conversation.
I feel energized when I’m part of a lively discussion or group activity.
I find quiet time alone more refreshing than social time with others.
In group settings, I am comfortable taking initiative when needed.
I feel comfortable walking up to someone and starting a conversation.
I find it fulfilling to support and encourage others.
I try to consider different viewpoints before forming an opinion.
I find it difficult to trust people easily.
I try to create a positive and harmonious atmosphere when interacting with others.
When someone is going through a tough time, I naturally want to be there for them.
I often think about things that happened during the day, even after they’re over.
I can usually stay calm and focused, even in stressful situations.
When facing uncertainty, I sometimes find myself thinking through all possible outcomes.
I find that after a setback, I’m able to shift my focus and move forward.
I notice when my mood changes and try to understand why.
